column4: in the wikipedia description of AIGLX they say it works like this: "This allows remote X clients to get fully hardware accelerated rendering over the GLX protocol." Does this mean if I have an ubuntu server with no 3d graphics, and a desktop with 3d graphics, I can remote into the server and play 3d games on the server but rendered locally?
of course

ok im going to try something crazy. i want to play dungeon keeper 2, which doesnt run very well on XP but my server is ubuntu, and dungeon keeper works fine in wine. i'm going to try to remote into my server to play dungeon keeper over RDMCP/AIGLX/WINE
good luck
how do i know i'm using AIGLX?
your xorg log will tell you. but to be hones I have no clue if xming supports 3D. I doubt it
ahhh i see
what about some other method of remote desktop like cygwin
that uses xming. I'd try to run virtualbox on windows and linux inside that. it supposedtly has hardware3D now for guests. you could try it
from the wiki article: xming now comes with mesa3d support...that's opengl right?
software3D.... tho for dungeonkeeper it might work if your CPU is good enough
the CPU of my server or the clien
X server. that's where it displays. and don't even thing to try under a 100Mbit connection
it's gigabit and the xserver is running on a 3.4ghz dualcore penryn
chances are good :)
i'll give it a shot and let you know if I can get it working soon
what xserver?
im sorry that was a bad question...i'll have some stuff to pastebin in a sec
xming is not ubuntu. we cannot and will not help you. ask elsewhere
cp <sourcefile>  /usr/local/bin    as root
well i'm guessing if I can get it to run in ubuntu, when I remote in it will work just like it was running locally
I doN't care what you guess. xmwing support is OT
fine forget i even mentioned xming, how do i get aiglx locally and natively
I cannot forget your trying to circumvent support policies. no go away and don't ask me underhandedly anymore
